instructions.instruction1): Add the water and chopped head of romaine to the blender. Starting the blender at low speed, mix until smooth. Gradually moving to higher speeds, add the celery and pear. Add the banana and lemon juice last.

Pomegranate-Farro Breakfast Salad with H.headline: Pomegranate-Farro Breakfast Salad with Honey Ricotta

instructions.instruction1): Combine first 3 ingredients in a small bowl.

instructions.instruction2): Combine oil, juice, and salt in a medium bowl. Add greens and farro; toss to coat. Arrange greens mixture in a shallow bowl; top with pomegranate, almonds, and ricotta mixture.

instructions.instruction1): Mash avocado onto toasted bread. Sprinkle with black pepper and a dash of kosher salt.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Coat a 9- x 5-inch loaf pan with cooking spray.

instructions.instruction2): Combine banana and next 5 ingredients (through eggs) in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer at medium speed until combined. Add sugars; beat until combined.

instructions.instruction3): Weigh or lightly spoon flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife. Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl, stirring with a whisk. Add flour mixture to banana mixture; beat just until combined. Fold in chocolate. Pour batter into prepared pan; sprinkle with sesame seeds.

instructions.instruction4): Bake at 350°F for 55 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes on a wire rack. Remove bread from pan; cool completely.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°F.

instructions.instruction2): Coat a 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray. Divide broccoli and bacon evenly among muffin cups.

instructions.instruction3): Crack eggs into a large bowl. Add milk, salt, and pepper; stir with a whisk until well combined. Divide egg mixture evenly among muffin cups. Sprinkle cheese evenly on top. Bake at 350°F for 18 minutes or until just set. Cool on a wire rack for 2 to 3 minutes. Carefully run an offset spatula or butter knife around edges to loosen frittatas.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°F.

instructions.instruction2): Combine zucchini, brown sugar, coconut milk, coconut oil, and eggs. Combine flour, soda, salt, and cinnamon.

instructions.instruction3): Stir in zucchini mixture; spoon into a greased 8- x 4-inch loaf pan. Bake for 50 to 55 minutes.

instructions.instruction1): Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium. Add corn and syrup; cook 3 minutes. Stir in oats and salt; cook 2 minutes. Add 3 cups water, milk, and nutmeg; cover, and simmer 5 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Combine yogurt and vanilla in a small bowl. Divide oatmeal among 4 bowls. Top each serving evenly with yogurt mixture and peaches.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 375°F.

instructions.instruction2): Boil 2/3 cup water and uncooked bulgur in a small saucepan; cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 12 minutes or until water is absorbed.

instructions.instruction3): Heat canola oil in a medium skillet over medium-high. Add chopped onion; sauté 3 minutes. Add kale; sauté until wilted, about 5 minutes (add 2 Tbsp. water if mixture starts to scorch). Stir in bulgur. Divide mixture among 8 muffin cups coated with cooking spray.

instructions.instruction4): Whisk together whole milk, chopped fresh thyme, kosher salt, black pepper, and eggs. Pour 1/4 cup into each muffin cup (cups will be very full). Sprinkle 3 oz. (3/4 cup) crumbled feta cheese evenly over cups. Bake 20 to 22 minutes, until set.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 450°F. Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. Using a pastry cutter, cut butter into flour mixture until mixture is crumbly and resembles small peas. Freeze mixture 5 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Stir in thyme, orange blossom water, and 3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons of the cream just until dry ingredients are moistened. Place dough on a sheet of wax paper. Gently press dough into a 7-inch round. (Mixture will be crumbly.) Cut round into 8 wedges. Place wedges 2 inches apart on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Brush tops of wedges with remaining 2 tablespoons cream just until moistened. (You may not need all of the cream.)

instructions.instruction3): Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, 13 to 15 minutes. Brush warm scones with Orange Blossom Glaze.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat broiler.

instructions.instruction2): Toss onion and tomato with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Place on baking sheet; broil 8 to 10 minutes or until tomatoes are lightly charred around the edges, turning once. Transfer to a blender; add chile and adobo sauce. Pulse until coarsely pureed.

instructions.instruction3): While tomato and onion roast, combine 1/2 cup water, lime juice, chili powder, salt, cumin, black beans, and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat, and simmer about 10 minutes or until beans are very tender. Partially mash bean mixture; cool to room temperature.

instructions.instruction4): Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add remaining 1 teaspoon olive oil to pan; swirl to coat. Add eggs; cook 3 to 4 minutes or until eggs are soft and beginning to set, stirring frequently. Remove pan from heat.

instructions.instruction5): Place tortillas on a work surface. Spread bottom third of each tortilla with 2 1/2 tablespoons bean mixture. Divide eggs evenly over beans. Top eggs with 2 tablespoons each tomato sauce, 1 avocado slice, and 1 teaspoon cilantro. Roll up, jelly-roll style.

instructions.instruction6): To freeze: Wrap each burrito in plastic wrap; place burritos in a large plastic freezer bag. Store for up to 3 months.

instructions.instruction7): To heat: Unwrap ­burritos; rewrap with a ­paper towel. Microwave at HIGH 3 to 4 minutes, turning once halfway through cooking.

instructions.instruction1): Spoon yogurt into an empty ice-cube tray; freeze 4 hours or overnight.

instructions.instruction2): Place 1 cup boiling water and dates in a bowl; let stand 10 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Place date mixture in a blender; blend 30 seconds or until smooth. Add frozen yogurt cubes, crushed ice, tahini, cinnamon, and salt to blender; blend until smooth. Divide mixture evenly among 4 glasses; chill 5 minutes before serving.

instructions.instruction1): AT HOME

instructions.instruction2): Combine oats, chia seeds, and salt in a small resealable plastic bag.

instructions.instruction3): IN CAMP

instructions.instruction4): The night before, pour oat mixture into a 2-qt. saucepan. Stir in 4 cups water. Bring to a boil and cook 1 minute, then remove from heat. Cover with a lid and place in a critter-free spot overnight, such as a bear box, if available. Or let mixture cool, transfer to a plastic bag, and seal in a bear canister.

instructions.instruction5): In the morning, heat oatmeal until simmering, stirring often and adding more water if you'd like it thinner. Spoon into bowls and top with almond butter, brown sugar if you like, and blueberries.

instructions.instruction6): *Chia seeds, when mixed with liquid, make no-cook pudding (find at natural-foods stores). Find almond butter packets at natural-foods stores.

instructions.instruction1): Place coconut milk and orange juice in a blender. Add banana, mango, and yogurt; process until smooth. Pour into a glass; top with walnuts.

Mixed Berry Scones With Lemon Ginger Gla.headline: Mixed Berry Scones With Lemon Ginger Glaze

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 400°.

instructions.instruction2): Gently beat egg in a medium bowl. Stir in vanilla extract, ½ cup heavy cream, and granulated sugar.

instructions.instruction3): Combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl; add butter to flour mixture. Cut the cubed butter into the flour mixture until small crumbs form.  Add cream mixture to the flour mixture and mix until a ball has formed.

instructions.instruction4): Dust a clean, flat surface with all-purpose flour and roll the dough out into a 9x9-inch square, about ½-inch-thick. Add berries to the center of the dough; spread berries out to form an even layer. Fold each side of the dough over the berries to form an enclosed square. Flip the dough and carefully roll it out to about ¾- to 1-inch thickness.

instructions.instruction5): Cut dough into 8 even, triangle-shaped pieces; arrange in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Use remaining 2 tablespoons heavy to brush over scones.

instructions.instruction6): Bake at 400° for 12 minutes, or until the scones are golden. Allow the scones to cool slightly on a wire rack.

instructions.instruction7): In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, lemon zest, grated ginger, and confectioners sugar until smooth. Drizzle the glaze over scones.

instructions.instruction1): Place banana in a small bowl, and use a fork to thoroughly mash. Add yogurt; mix to combine.

instructions.instruction2): Add oats, chia seeds, salt, and almond milk; mix well. Cover and refrigerate overnight or at least 6 hours.

instructions.instruction3): Top with mixed berries and walnuts.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat broiler to high with oven rack in upper middle position.

instructions.instruction2): Heat an 8-inch ovenproof skillet over medium. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add kale and roasted butternut squash; cook 2 to 3 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Whisk together eggs, yogurt, salt, and pepper. Add eggs to pan, and cook 2 minutes, stirring slowly and tilting the skillet a few times so runny parts hit the pan.

instructions.instruction4): Place pan under broiler; broil 1 minute or until eggs are almost set. Top frittata with avocado.

instructions.instruction1): Place all ingredients in a blender; process 1 minute or until completely smooth. Divide mixture evenly between 2 glasses.
Place dates in a small bowl; cover with hot water. Let stand 3 minutes or until softened; drain.

instructions.instruction2): Place milk and dates in a blender; blend 30 seconds or until pureed. Add ice and remaining ingredients; blend 30 seconds or until smooth.

instructions.instruction3): Variation 1

instructions.instruction4): Chocolate-Peanut Butter: Decrease chocolate almond milk to 3/4 cup and vanilla soy yogurt to 1/2 cup; add 2 tsp. natural peanut or almond butter when processing remaining ingredients in Step

instructions.instruction5): Serves 1 (serving size: about 2 1/4 cups)

instructions.instruction6): CALORIES 329; FAT 11g (sat 3g, mono 7g, poly 4g); PROTEIN 9g; CARB 54g; FIBER 7g; SUGARS 33g (est. added sugars 10g); CHOL 0mg; IRON 3mg; SODIUM 186mg; CALC 368mg

instructions.instruction7): Variation 2 Chocolate-Raspberry: Omit ice. Add 1/2 cup frozen unsweetened raspberries when processing remaining ingredients in Step Serves 1 (serving size: about 2 1/3 cups) CALORIES 326; FAT 2g (sat 5g, mono 7g, poly 5g); PROTEIN 9g; CARB 65g; FIBER 10g; SUGARS 39g (est. added sugars 13g); CHOL 0mg; IRON 3mg; SODIUM 200mg; CALC 491mg

instructions.instruction1): Place yogurt and jam in a blender. Add strawberries and remaining ingredients; process until smooth.

Soft-Yolk Muffins with Sausage and Chees.headline: Soft-Yolk Muffins with Sausage and Cheese

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 400°F. Coat a 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray.

instructions.instruction2): Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil over high. Carefully lower 12 medium eggs into water with a strainer or slotted spoon. Boil 4 minutes and 30 seconds; immediately plunge into a bowl of ice water. Cool 10 minutes. Peel eggs.

instructions.instruction3): Heat a small nonstick skillet over medium-high. Add sausage to pan; cook 4 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally to crumble. Drain on paper towels.

instructions.instruction4): Whisk together flours, baking powder, sugar, baking soda, and pepper in a large bowl. Whisk together buttermilk, oil, and large eggs in a separate large bowl until smooth. Add flour mixture to buttermilk mixture; stir with a wooden spoon or rubber spatula until smooth. Fold in two-thirds of sausage and 2 ounces cheese.

instructions.instruction5): Divide half of batter evenly among cups of prepared muffin pan. Nestle 1 peeled cooked egg vertically into batter in each cup. Top with remaining batter. Sprinkle muffins with remaining sausage and remaining 2 ounces cheese.

instructions.instruction6): Bake at 400°F on bottom rack until cheese melts and a wooden pick inserted in center comes out with moist crumbs, about 17 minutes. Remove from oven; cool on a wire rack 10 minutes. Carefully run an offset spatula or butter knife around edges to loosen muffins.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 375°.

instructions.instruction2): Flatten each bread slice with a rolling pin until very thin. Trim crusts off bread. Lightly brush both sides of bread slices with melted butter. Cut each bread slice in half diagonally.

instructions.instruction3): With cut sides facing, place 2 bread halves in each of 6 muffin cups, making sure to cover bottom entirely and allowing bread corners to extend above rims. Bake at 375° for 5 minutes or until bread is slightly firm. Remove pan from oven; sprinkle 2 teaspoons shredded cheese into each cup. Top each cup with 2 teaspoons chopped tomato. Crack 1 egg into each cup; sprinkle eggs evenly with salt and pepper. Bake an additional 18 minutes or until whites are set and yolks are still a bit runny or to desired degree of doneness. Remove egg cups from pan; sprinkle evenly with bacon and chives, if desired.

Make a Chocolate Smoothie That Isn't Ful.headline: Make a Chocolate Smoothie That Isn't Full of Life-Shortening Sugar

instructions.instruction1): Place ice cubes, yogurt, coffee concentrate, ground flaxseed, cocoa, maple syrup or honey, and vanilla in a blender; process until smooth.

Corn Muffins with Prosciutto, Sun-Dried.headline: Corn Muffins with Prosciutto, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, and Goat Cheese

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 375°F. Coat a 12-cup muffin pan with cooking spray.

instructions.instruction2): Whisk together flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and pepper in a large bowl. Whisk together buttermilk, butter, and eggs in a large bowl until smooth. Add flour mixture to buttermilk mixture; stir with a wooden spoon or rubber spatula until smooth. Fold in chives, two-thirds (about 2 1/2 ounces) of prosciutto, 1/4 cup tomatoes, and 2 ounces cheese.

instructions.instruction3): Divide batter evenly among cups of prepared muffin pan. Sprinkle muffins with remaining prosciutto, remaining 1/4 cup tomatoes, and remaining 2 ounces cheese.

instructions.instruction4): Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes or until cheese melts and a wooden pick inserted in center of muffin comes out with moist crumbs. Remove from oven; cool on a wire rack 10 minutes. Carefully run an offset spatula or butter knife around edges to loosen muffins.

instructions.instruction1): Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Serve immediately.

labels.Yield: Makes: 4 servings (serving size: 1/2 cup yogurt, 1 tbsp. honey, 1/2 cup fruit)

instructions.instruction1): In a small skillet, toast spice on low, stirring, until very fragrant, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat, add honey and stir.

instructions.instruction2): Divide yogurt among 4 bowls. Drizzle with spiced honey; top with granola, fruit and cilantro. Serve.

Breakfast Barley with Banana & Sunflower.headline: Breakfast Barley with Banana & Sunflower Seeds

instructions.instruction1): Combine water and barley in a small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave at HIGH 6 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Stir and let stand 2 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Top with banana slices, honey, and sunflower seeds.

Toast with Walnut & Pear Breakfast Sprea.headline: Toast with Walnut & Pear Breakfast Spread

labels.Yield: 1 serving (serving size: 2 pieces toast; 1 cup spread)

instructions.instruction1): Place cottage cheese in a blender or food processor; process until smooth. Transfer to a small bowl.

instructions.instruction2): Stir pear and walnuts into cottage cheese.

instructions.instruction3): Spread cottage cheese mixture on toast.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°F. Place 1 piecrust on a lightly floured surface, and roll into a 12-inch circle. Using a 3- x 2 1/2-inch rectangular cutter, cut piecrust into 12 rectangles. Repeat process with remaining 3 piecrusts to make 48 rectangles.

instructions.instruction2): Place 24 dough rectangles 2 inches apart on 2 parchment paper-lined baking sheets. Top each rectangle with 1/2 tablespoon cranberry sauce, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Working 1 at a time, moisten dough edges with water, and top with remaining dough rectangles, pressing edges with a fork to seal.

instructions.instruction3): Whisk together egg and milk in a small bowl; brush over tops of pastries. Cut 1 to 2 small X's in top of each pastry to allow steam to escape while baking.

instructions.instruction4): Bake pastries in preheated oven until golden, 25 to 30 minutes. Transfer pastries to a wire rack; cool 15 minutes.

instructions.instruction5): Stir together powdered sugar, zest, and 1 tablespoon of the orange juice in a small bowl. Stir in orange juice, 1 teaspoon at a time, up to 1 tablespoon, until mixture reaches desired consistency and is smooth. Drizzle on pastries.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 400°. In a medium cast-iron or nonstick frying pan over medium heat, sauté onions in oil until soft, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, combine eggs, salt, and pepper in a bowl and beat lightly just until blended.

instructions.instruction2): Pour egg mixture into frying pan and sprinkle in gruyère, sage, and rosemary. Stir ­gently with a wooden spoon until mixture begins to set, about 2 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Cover frying pan, transfer to oven, and bake until frittata is puffed and set, 12 to 14 minutes. Cut into 6 slices, and serve immediately, sprinkled with basil.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat broiler with oven rack in upper middle position.

instructions.instruction2): Combine 1 1/2 teaspoons oil and potatoes in a microwave-safe bowl; cover with plastic wrap. Microwave at HIGH 3 minutes or until just tender. Uncover; cool slightly.

instructions.instruction3): Combine milk and next 7 ingredients (through egg whites) in a bowl, stirring with a whisk.

instructions.instruction4): Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a nonstick ovenproof skillet over medium-high. Add potatoes; sauté 6 minutes or until browned. Reduce heat to medium-low; add egg mixture, and cook 5 minutes. Top evenly with grilled vegetable mixture. Place pan in oven, and broil 3 minutes or until egg is set. Cut into 8 wedges.

An Easy Salmon Frittata You Can Make in.headline: An Easy Salmon Frittata You Can Make in 15 Minutes

instructions.instruction1): Preheat the broiler.

instructions.instruction2): In a large, broiler-proof skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and green onions and sauté until the white onion is translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Meanwhile, crack the eggs into a large bowl and whisk to blend thoroughly. Stir in the salmon.

instructions.instruction4): Reduce the heat to medium-low, push the onion to the edge of the skillet, and pour in the egg/salmon mixture, making sure the salmon is evenly distributed amid the egg. Use a wooden spoon or rubber spatula to spread the onion in the pan. Lay the cheese slices evenly across the top of the egg. Garnish with the oregano. Cook until the bottom of the egg has set, 3 to 5 minutes. The top of the frittata should still be runny.

instructions.instruction5): Transfer the skillet to the top oven rack directly under the broiler. Cook the frittata until the top sizzles and takes on a golden brown hue, 3 to 5 minutes.

instructions.instruction6): Remove the pan from the oven, cut the frittata into quarters, and serve immediately with freshly ground pepper to taste.

instructions.instruction1): Bring a small pan of lightly salted water to a boil, and cook the asparagus tips for 2–3 minutes, until just tender. Drain.

instructions.instruction3): Meanwhile, beat the eggs and egg whites with 1/2 tsp dill, and season. Quarter the artichokes, and add to the eggs. Spray a small nonstick frying pan with the oil, place over medium heat, and pour in the egg mixture. Top with the asparagus tips, and then sprinkle with the cheese and remaining dill. Cook gently without stirring for 2–3 minutes until beginning to set, and then slide under a medium-hot broiler for 3–5 minutes until risen and golden.

instructions.instruction5): Remove, slide onto a serving plate, and cut into wedges.

Broccolini, Red Pepper, and Roasted Garl.headline: Broccolini, Red Pepper, and Roasted Garlic Frittata

instructions.instruction1): Heat a small saucepan over medium-low. Add oil and garlic; cook, stirring occasionally and adjusting the heat as needed to keep garlic from browning too quickly, 25 to 30 minutes or until garlic is very soft. Drain oil into a small bowl; reserve oil. Place garlic cloves, eggs, and cottage cheese in a food processor; process until smooth. Transfer mixture to a medium bowl.

instructions.instruction2): Preheat broiler with oven rack 6 inches from heat. Trim Broccolini stems from tops; cut tops and stems into bite-size pieces. Heat a 10-inch nonstick ovenproof skillet over medium-high. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons reserved garlic oil to pan; swirl to coat. Add Broccolini stems, bell pepper, and onion; cook, stirring often, 5 minutes or until vegetables are slightly tender. Add Broccolini tops; cook 5 to 6 minutes or until Broccolini is bright green and bell peppers are tender. Fold vegetable mixture, parsley, oregano, salt, and black pepper into egg mixture.

instructions.instruction3): Heat 1 1/2 teaspoons garlic oil in skillet over medium-high; swirl to coat. Pour egg mixture into skillet; cook 30 seconds. Reduce heat to medium-low; cook, without stirring, until eggs are partially cooked, about 4 minutes.

instructions.instruction4): Transfer skillet to oven; broil until eggs are set and top of frittata is lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Remove from oven; run a spatula around edges of frittata to loosen. Cut into 8 wedges. Serve immediately.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat broiler to high, and set a rack 6 inches from the heat.

instructions.instruction2): Break eggs into a small bowl. Use a fork to beat them like a back-talking bass drum until completely blended and slightly frothy. Stir in half the pepper and half the salt.

instructions.instruction3): Heat olive oil in an 8-inch cast-iron skillet over medium-high. Add mushrooms to pan; sauté 4 minutes or until nicely browned. Stir in kale and remaining salt and pepper; sauté 30 seconds or until kale is just wilted. Add eggs; stir slowly and tilt the skillet a few times so runny parts hit the pan. After about 2 minutes, when the eggs are lightly browned on the bottom with a few shiny spots still on top, sprinkle with cheese.

instructions.instruction4): Place pan under broiler; broil 1 minute or until cheese softens and golden-brown spots appear on egg. Slide frittata onto a plate.

instructions.instruction5): Choose Your Own Pan

instructions.instruction6): Do you like the low cost of nonstick pans? Are you ok with replacing them every now and then?

instructions.instruction7): You need: Tramontina ProLine 8-inch fry pan. The commercial-grade surface is as durable and stick-proof as you're likely to find, at a price point that's hard to beat. At Costco, a two-pack set (8- and 10-inch) is $

instructions.instruction8): Do you hate replacing pans? Are you serious enough about eggs to season a pan you can use for a lifetime?

instructions.instruction9): You need: Mauviel M'Steel 8-inch round frying pan. The carbon steel needs seasoning and light upkeep, but gives you a durable, oven-safe nonstick pan. $40, mauvielusa.com

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°F. Whisk together eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and Gruyère in a medium bowl. Gently fold in green beans, Brussels sprouts, asparagus, squash, dressing, parsley, and chives.

instructions.instruction2): Heat oil in a 10-inch nonstick oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Pour egg mixture into skillet. Stir once, and cook until edges start to pull away from sides of skillet, 5 to 7 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Transfer to preheated oven, and bake until set, 15 to 20 minutes. Slice into wedges; serve immediately.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat broiler to high.

instructions.instruction2): Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl, stirring well with a whisk.

instructions.instruction3): Heat a medium ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add oil to pan; swirl to coat. Add shallots; sauté 3 minutes or until translucent. Add egg mixture to pan; cook 5 minutes or until eggs are partially set. Sprinkle with 3 tablespoons cheese. Arrange tomatoes over egg mixture. Sprinkle remaining 2 tablespoons cheese over top. Place pan in oven; broil 2 to 3 minutes or until top is lightly browned and eggs are set. Remove pan from oven. Cut frittata into 8 wedges. Garnish with thyme sprigs, if desired.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°. Whisk together eggs, cream, and 1/4 tsp. salt.

instructions.instruction2): Cook potatoes in hot oil in a 10-inch ovenproof nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, stirring often, 1 minute. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 tsp salt. Reduce heat to medium, and cook, stirring often, 3 to 4 minutes or until light golden brown on both sides. Transfer potatoes to a bowl.

instructions.instruction3): Return skillet to heat; melt 1 tsp. butter in skillet. Add zucchini; cook, stirring often, 2 to 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add remaining 2 tsp. butter to skillet; let melt. Add potatoes, stirring to coat.

instructions.instruction4): Pour egg mixture over potatoes. Reduce heat to medium-low; cook 1 minute. Sprinkle with cheese.

instructions.instruction5): Bake at 350° for 8 to 9 minutes or until center is set. Remove from oven; invert onto a serving plate.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 450º. Process first 4 ingredients in a blender until blended. Stir together chives and next 2 ingredients in a small bowl. Place 8 lightly greased 4-inch (6-oz.) ramekins on 2 baking sheets; layer tomatoes, 1 cup cheese, and chive mixture in ramekins. Pour egg mixture over top, and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese.

instructions.instruction2): Bake at 450° for 7 minutes, placing 1 baking sheet on middle oven rack and other on lower oven rack. Switch baking sheets, and bake 7 to 8 more minutes or until set. Remove top baking sheet from oven; transfer bottom sheet to middle rack, and bake 1 to 2 more minutes or until lightly browned.

instructions.instruction3): Tomato-Herb Frittata: Prepare recipe as directed, substituting a lightly greased 13- x 9-inch baking dish for ramekins and increasing bake time to 18 to 20 minutes or until set. Note: Mixture will rise about 1 inch above rim of baking dish. Hands-on time: 10 min.; Total time: 30 min.

Red Pepper, Potato, and Ricotta Frittata.headline: Red Pepper, Potato, and Ricotta Frittata

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°. Tear roasted red bell pepper into bite-size pieces to equal 1/3 cup.

instructions.instruction2): Whisk together eggs, Parmesan cheese, garlic, parsley, chives, salt, pepper, and 1/4 cup water in a large bowl until frothy.

instructions.instruction3): Pour half of egg mixture into a lightly greased 10-inch ovenproof nonstick skillet. Place potatoes in a single layer over egg mixture. Pour remaining egg mixture over potatoes. Dot ricotta by tablespoonfuls over egg mixture, and top with red pepper pieces.

instructions.instruction4): Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes or until puffy and set. Serve immediately.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°F.

instructions.instruction2): Combine milk, flour, salt, pepper, eggs, and cheese in a medium bowl, stirring with a whisk. Heat oil in a medium ovenproof skillet over medium. Add leek to pan; cook until tender and lightly browned, about 3 minutes. Add garlic; cook 30 seconds. Add egg mixture; stir gently to distribute leek evenly. Cover skillet, and reduce heat to low. Cook until eggs are partially set, about 6 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Uncover skillet, and bake at 350°F until center is set, 10 to 12 minutes. Loosen frittata from skillet, and slide onto a cutting board. Cut into 8 wedges.

instructions.instruction1): Set an oven rack about 6 inches from heat source; preheat broiler to high.

instructions.instruction2): Warm oil in a large, ovenproof nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add kale and cook, stirring, until wilted, about 3 minutes. Add scallions; sauté for 1 minute. Stir in ham; sauté 1 minute longer.

instructions.instruction3): Whisk eggs and cheese; season with salt and pepper. Arrange kale mixture evenly in skillet and pour egg mixture over. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook without stirring until frittata is almost set in center, 10 to 12 minutes.

instructions.instruction4): Transfer skillet to broiler and cook, watching carefully to avoid burning, until top is set and golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Run a spatula around edges of skillet and cut into wedges (to safeguard your pan, you can slide frittata onto serving plate before slicing). Serve hot, or allow to cool and serve at room temperature.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°. Arrange bacon on microwave-safe paper towels; cover with additional paper towels. Microwave at HIGH 3 minutes or until done. Crumble bacon.

instructions.instruction2): While bacon cooks, heat a medium cast-iron or ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil to pan; swirl to coat. Add zucchini; sauté 4 minutes, stirring occasionally.

instructions.instruction3): Sprinkle tomatoes and bacon over zucchini. Reduce heat to medium.

instructions.instruction4): Combine milk and remaining ingredients in a large bowl, stirring well with a whisk or fork.

instructions.instruction5): Pour milk mixture over zucchini mixture in pan. Cook 5 minutes or until mixture is partially set.

instructions.instruction6): Place pan in oven. Bake at 350° for 9 minutes or until center is set. Cut into 4 wedges.

instructions.instruction7): 3 Ways to Riff: • Omit bacon for a vegetarian version. • Swap in 4 cups coarsely chopped kale or Swiss chard for zucchini. • Play with different cheeses: Try reduced-fat sharp cheddar or pepper-Jack for a bit of heat.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat broiler with a rack set 4 in. from heat. Heat oil in a large, ovenproof frying pan over high heat. Cook sausage, stirring often, until browned, about 3 minutes. Add bell pepper, mushrooms, and onion and cook until vegetables are softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in Swiss chard, reduce heat to medium, and cook, stirring occasionally, until wilted, about 10 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Meanwhile, whisk eggs in a large bowl until starting to foam. Stir in cheese and salt. Pour mixture into pan with vegetables; cook on stove until the bottom sets, about 3 minutes. Broil until firm and browned, 3 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Note: Nutritional analysis is per serving.

Asparagus, Nettle, and Green Garlic Frit.headline: Asparagus, Nettle, and Green Garlic Frittata

instructions.instruction1): Heat broiler.

instructions.instruction2): Melt butter in a 10-in. ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add green garlic and cook until it begins to soften, 1 to 2 minutes. Add asparagus and continue sautéing until asparagus is crisp-tender, another 3 to 4 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Pile nettles into skillet--with tongs!--and toss to wilt and tenderize, 2 to 3 minutes. Season everything with salt and pepper.

instructions.instruction4): Beat eggs with a fork or a whisk in a medium bowl until they are fully blended and just slightly foamy. Season with salt and pepper. Pour eggs into pan over the garlic, asparagus, and nettles, scraping everything out with a rubber spatula.

instructions.instruction5): Let eggs cook without disturbing them for about 1 minute. Then, with a silicone spatula or a table knife, gently lift edges of eggs, letting liquid eggs pour over the edge and underneath. Let that set for another few seconds and then continue lifting and letting eggs flow. This will create layers and make the frittata lighter.

instructions.instruction6): When eggs aren't super runny anymore but top is still moist and undercooked, slide pan under broiler for a minute or two to lightly brown top of frittata.

instructions.instruction7): Careful, the pan handle is hot now! Run spatula or a small knife around edge of frittata and then tip pan over onto a cutting board or cooling rack. Shake and tap to release frittata. If a bit sticks to the pan and rips, don't worry, just piece it back together. Let frittata cool until it's just warm, and serve in wedges.

instructions.instruction8): *Find at farmers' markets and well-stocked grocery stores.

Herby Frittata with Vegetables and Goat.headline: Herby Frittata with Vegetables and Goat Cheese

instructions.instruction1): Combine asparagus and 1/4 cup water in a small microwave-safe bowl; cover and microwave at HIGH 2 minutes or until tender. Rinse with cold water; drain. Combine chives, dill, salt, pepper, and eggs in a medium bowl; stir with a whisk.

instructions.instruction2): Preheat broiler to high.

instructions.instruction3): Heat a small ovenproof nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add oil; swirl to coat. Add asparagus and egg mixture to pan; cook 3 minutes or until eggs are partially set, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with cheese. Place pan under broiler. Broil 2 minutes or until eggs are set and top is lightly browned. Remove pan from oven. Run a spatula around edge and under frittata to loosen from pan; slide frittata onto a plate or cutting board. Cut into 4 wedges.

This Cheesy Cannabis Frittata Is Totally.headline: This Cheesy Cannabis Frittata Is Totally Dope

instructions.instruction1): Properly decarboxylize cured buds: Preheat your oven to 220°F. Take a baking sheet and lay your ground-up medical cannabis buds onto the sheet, making sure that it is evenly dispersed. Place the baking sheet into the oven uncovered and heat for 25 minutes. Pull the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool completely. You now have decarboxylized, or “activated,” medical cannabis that is ready for consumption. When you place this decarboxylized weed into recipes, it will “activate” further between the heat of the cooking process and any lipid content contained within the recipe.

instructions.instruction2): In a large glass bowl, whip the eggs with a whisk until well incorporated with air.

instructions.instruction3): Add the minced onion, garlic, sliced tomato, portabella mushrooms, ground cannabis, olive oil and spinach into the bowl. Fold this mixture with a whisk until everything is well combined.

instructions.instruction4): Pour into seasoned cast iron skillet or one that has been oiled with non-medicated olive oil.

instructions.instruction5): Sprinkle the goat cheese across the egg mixture and garnish with 6 large basil leaves.

instructions.instruction6): Bake uncovered in the center of the oven at 350°F for 35 minutes.

instructions.instruction7): Pull from the oven then slice into 8 sections and serve.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°.

instructions.instruction2): Combine coffee and next 3 ingredients, stirring with a whisk. Add granulated sugar and next 3 ingredients, stirring with a whisk.

instructions.instruction3): Lightly spoon flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife. Combine flour and next 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Make a well in center of mixture. Gradually add honey mixture, stirring with a whisk just until blended. Stir in almonds.

instructions.instruction4): Pour into a 13 x 9-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray.

instructions.instruction5): Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until cake springs back when lightly touched in center. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Sift powdered sugar over top of cake.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 450°F.

instructions.instruction2): Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat. Drain.

instructions.instruction3): Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add onion and garlic; sauté 2 minutes. Add eggplant and bell pepper; cook 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add zucchini, tomato, and chickpeas; cover and cook 4 minutes. Remove pan from heat; stir in 1 cup marinara, 1/2 cup basil, black pepper, and salt.

instructions.instruction4): Coat a 2-quart glass or ceramic baking dish with cooking spray. Spread remaining 3/4 cup marinara over bottom of dish. Spoon about 2 tablespoons vegetable mixture into each pasta shell. Arrange filled shells in dish; sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 450°F for 12 minutes. Top with remaining 2 tablespoons basil.

instructions.instruction1): Place a rack in the top third of the oven and preheat to 375°F. Mist a 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook pasta until al dente, about 7 minutes or as package label directs. Drain and place back in pot.

instructions.instruction2): In a pan over medium-high heat, bring milk and squash to a simmer, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add mustard, 1/2 tsp. salt, cayenne and Cheddar, stirring until cheese has melted. Stir sauce into pasta and toss until pasta is well-coated. Transfer mixture to baking dish.

instructions.instruction3): In a small bowl, mix butter, panko and Parmesan; sprinkle over macaroni. Bake until bubbling around edges and beginning to brown on top, about 20 minutes. Turn broiler to high and cook until top is golden and crispy, about 2 minutes, watching carefully to be sure it doesn't burn. Let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Poached Orange-Fennel Salmon with Dill C.headline: Poached Orange-Fennel Salmon with Dill Crème

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 325°. Cut a sheet of 18-in.-wide heavy-duty foil three times as long as salmon and center it on a rimmed baking sheet, letting ends hang over. Set salmon, skin side down, on foil. Sprinkle fish evenly with orange zest, shallot, and fennel bulb. Bring corners and sides of foil up around salmon to make a canoe with 2-in. sides.

instructions.instruction2): Pour orange juice into a glass measuring cup and add vermouth to make 3/4 cup. Microwave until steaming (about 170°) and pour evenly over fish. Drizzle with 1 tbsp. oil and sprinkle evenly with 1/2 tsp. salt, the pepper, coriander, and juniper berries. Tightly roll ends and sides of foil together to create a pouch.

instructions.instruction3): Bake salmon until cooked through three-quarters of the way from edge to center of thickest part (which will still look wet; open foil and cut fish to check), 12 to 25 minutes, depending on thickness.

instructions.instruction4): Slide two long metal spatulas under fish and carefully transfer to a long platter (Murray likes to use a madeleine pan), leaving poaching liquid behind. Sprinkle radishes, about 1/2 tsp. salt, and remaining 1 tbsp. oil over fish. Scatter torn fennel fronds on top. Serve with Dill Crème.

instructions.instruction5): *Ask a fishmonger to remove bones, or do it yourself, using fish tweezers or pliers.

instructions.instruction6): Make ahead: Through step 3, up to 1 day, chilled; bring to room temperature.

Blueberry Bread Pudding With Lemon Hard.headline: Blueberry Bread Pudding With Lemon Hard Sauce

labels.Yield: Serves 8  (serving size: about 1 cup bread pudding, 2 Tbsp. sauce)

instructions.instruction1): Prepare the Blueberry Bread Pudding: Preheat oven to 400°F. Spread cake cubes in a single layer in a lightly greased (with cooking spray) large rimmed baking pan. Bake in preheated oven until lightly toasted, 10 to 12 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack, and cool 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F.

instructions.instruction2): Whisk together eggs, sugar, lemon zest, vanilla, and salt in a large bowl until well blended. Whisk in milk and heavy cream until well blended.

instructions.instruction3): Add cake cubes to egg mixture, and gently toss until coated. Let stand 20 minutes. Stir in 1 cup of the blueberries.

instructions.instruction4): Spread pound cake mixture in a lightly greased (with cooking spray) 11- x 7-inch baking dish; sprinkle top with remaining 1 cup blueberries. Bake at 350°F until set in the center, 45 to 50 minutes.

instructions.instruction5): Prepare the Lemon Hard Sauce: Beat together softened butter, lemon zest, and lemon juice at medium speed with an electric mixer until creamy. Gradually add powdered sugar, beating until light and fluffy. Serve immediately with warm bread pudding.

instructions.instruction1): Combine ingredients in a medium bowl. Chill until ready to serve.

instructions.instruction2): Young Chefs can:

instructions.instruction3): Pour tuna in colander or strainer to drain

instructions.instruction4): Measure chopped celery

instructions.instruction5): Older Chefs can:

instructions.instruction6): Break up big pieces of tuna with a fork

instructions.instruction7): Combine measured ingredients

Peach Bread Pudding with Bourbon Caramel.headline: Peach Bread Pudding with Bourbon Caramel

instructions.instruction1): Prepare the Bread Pudding: Whisk together egg yolks, milk, vanilla extract, cinnamon, salt, 2 cups heavy cream, and 2/3 cup granulated sugar in a large bowl until thoroughly combined. Add bread pieces, and toss to coat pieces evenly. Cover and chill 8 to 12 hours to allow bread to absorb the liquid.

instructions.instruction2): Preheat oven to 350°F. Gently rub peaches under running water to remove fuzz, and chop peaches. (You will have about 6 1/2 cups.) Beat egg whites with an electric mixer on high speed until soft peaks form. Remove soaked bread from refrigerator; stir in 4 tablespoons salted butter pieces and chopped peaches. Fold in whipped egg whites until combined. Transfer mixture to a well-greased (with butter) 13- x 9-inch baking dish or a large cast-iron skillet. Cover loosely with aluminum foil, and bake in preheated oven until it puffs in the center, about 45 minutes. Remove foil, and bake until the top is lightly browned, 25 to 30 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Prepare the Bourbon Caramel: Melt 2 tablespoons unsalted butter in a medium saucepan over medium-high; stir in water and 1 cup granulated sugar. Cook, without stirring, until mixture is a medium shade of brown, 4 to 6 minutes. Carefully whisk in 1 cup heavy cream. (Mixture will bubble up as the cream is added.) Remove from heat, and whisk in bourbon. Serve Bourbon Caramel warm with the Bread Pudding.

Zucchini and Goat Cheese Quiche (Quiche.headline: Zucchini and Goat Cheese Quiche (Quiche de Courgettes au Chèvre)

instructions.instruction1): Weigh or lightly spoon flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife. Place flour, butter, and cream cheese in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add yogurt; pulse just until mixture comes together. Wrap dough in plastic wrap, and shape into a 1-inch-thick disk. Refrigerate at least 1 hour.

instructions.instruction2): Preheat oven to 400°.

instructions.instruction3): Roll dough to a 5-inch circle on a lightly floured work surface. Fit dough into a 10-inch removable-bottom tart pan, pressing dough against bottom and up sides of pan. Pierce bottom of dough liberally with a fork. Line bottom of dough with parchment paper; arrange pie weights or dried beans on parchment paper. Bake at 400° for 15 minutes. Remove pie weights and parchment paper; bake at 400° for 5 minutes or until crust is lightly browned. Cool slightly.

instructions.instruction4): Place zucchini in a large bowl; sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt. Let stand 15 minutes or until liquid is released. Drain in a colander, squeezing a handful at a time to remove liquid, and pat dry. Combine remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, milk, thyme, pepper, and eggs in a bowl, stirring with a whisk. Sprinkle ham and goat cheese evenly over bottom of prepared crust; arrange zucchini over cheese. Carefully pour egg mixture over zucchini; top with thyme sprigs. Bake at 400° for 35 minutes or until egg is set. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut into wedges.

instructions.instruction1): Stir together eggs, mayonnaise, radish, dill, scallion, and salt in a bowl. Spread 1 heaping Tbsp. egg salad on each baguette slice.
Combine first 6 ingredients (through lime juice) in a small bowl; stir in 1/4 teaspoon salt.

instructions.instruction2): Combine remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt with eggs and cumin. Heat a medium nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heat. Add egg mixture; cook 2 minutes, stirring gently until set. Remove from heat; sprinkle with cheese.

instructions.instruction3): Warm tortillas according to package directions. Top each tortilla with a lettuce leaf and 1/4 cup corn mixture. Divide egg mixture evenly among tortillas; roll up. Serve immediately.

instructions.instruction1): In a medium saucepan, combine the milk, bulgur, dried cherries, and salt; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook, stirring frequently, until the bulgur is tender and the consistency of oatmeal (10-15 minutes).

instructions.instruction2): Divide hot porridge among 4 bowls; top with the apricots and almonds.

Spinach and Egg Breakfast Wrap with Avoc.headline: Spinach and Egg Breakfast Wrap with Avocado and Pepper Jack Cheese

instructions.instruction1): Spray a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.

instructions.instruction2): Add spinach and cook, stirring, until wilted, 2 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Whisk together eggs and egg whites in a small bowl. Add eggs to skillet and cook, stirring, until cooked through, 3–4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

instructions.instruction4): Place 1/4 of egg mixture in the center of each tortilla, and sprinkle with 1 ounce cheese.

instructions.instruction5): Top with 4 slices avocado and fold, burrito-style.  Slice in half and serve.

Banana and Brown Rice Breakfast Pudding.headline: Banana and Brown Rice Breakfast Pudding

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a shallow 11-by-7-inch (2-quart) baking dish. In a medium bowl, stir brown rice, milk, cinnamon stick, 1/4 cup sugar, vanilla and salt until combined. Pour mixture into baking dish.

instructions.instruction2): Spread remaining 2 Tbsp. sugar on a flat plate. Dip bananas in sugar and nestle into pudding mixture. Bake until milk is almost completely absorbed and bananas are tender, 25 to 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes, then discard cinnamon stick and serve.

labels.Yield: 1 serving (serving size: 2 pieces topped toast and 1 orange)

instructions.instruction1): Top each bread slice with 4 basil leaves, 2 tomato slices, and 1 slice cheese.

instructions.instruction2): Melt open-faced sandwiches in toaster oven or under broiler 45 minutes or until cheese is bubbling. Serve with orange wedges.

labels.Yield: 1 serving (serving size: 1 omelet and 2 pieces toast)

instructions.instruction1): Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add broccoli, and cook 3 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Combine eggs, Feta, and dill in a small bowl. Add egg mixture to pan. Cook 34 minutes; fold in half with a spatula and cook 2 more minutes or until cooked through. Serve with toast.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°.

instructions.instruction2): Mix all ingredients in a large bowl, stirring slowly with a wooden spoon until well combined.

instructions.instruction3): Spray a 9- x 13-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Pour batter into pan, and spread evenly.

instructions.instruction4): Bake 25 minutes or until just golden brown around edges. Cool and cut into squares.

instructions.instruction1): Spread almond butter on toast.

instructions.instruction2): Top with banana slices.

Banana Yogurt Parfait with Maple Oat Top.headline: Banana Yogurt Parfait with Maple Oat Topping

instructions.instruction1): Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. In a small bowl, combine oats and maple syrup; add oat mixture to pan, and cook 23 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Place yogurt in a bowl and top with banana and toasted oats.

Blueberry Oat Pancakes with Maple Yogurt.headline: Blueberry Oat Pancakes with Maple Yogurt

labels.Yield: 2 servings (serving size: 3 (3-inch) pancakes and about 1/2 cup yogurt mixture)

instructions.instruction1): Combine oats, cottage cheese, eggs, and vanilla in a blender or food processor; process until smooth. Gently stir in the blueberries.

instructions.instruction2): Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Spoon about 2 tablespoons batter per pancake into pan. Cook 3 minutes or until tops are covered with bubbles and edges look cooked. Carefully turn pancakes over, and cook 3 more minutes or until golden.

instructions.instruction3): Combine yogurt and maple syrup; serve alongside pancakes.

instructions.instruction1): Vigorously whisk the eggs, egg white, and salt and pepper in a bowl.

instructions.instruction2): Heat a small skillet over medium-low heat. When hot, coat lightly with cooking spray. Cook chopped chilies and tomatoes until soft (2 minutes). Add eggs. Cook, stirring gently, until eggs are cooked through, as desired (1-2 minutes). Sprinkle with scallion. Serve hot.

labels.Yield: Makes 4 servings (serving size: 2 slices french toast, 1/2 teaspoon powdered sugar, 2 teaspoons maple syrup, and 1/2 cup berries)

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 200°.

instructions.instruction2): Place a large shallow baking dish in oven to warm.

instructions.instruction3): Combine first 7 ingredients (through salt) in a large bowl, stirring well with a whisk. (You should have about 2 cups batter.) Place 2 slices of bread in batter; soak 1-2 minutes.

instructions.instruction4): Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat; coat pan with cooking spray. Remove bread slices from the batter; drain slightly. Place bread in skillet; cook until golden (2-3 minutes on each side), flipping once. Transfer toast to warm baking dish in oven. Repeat steps with the remaining bread slices.

instructions.instruction5): Place 2 slices of French toast on 4 plates. Sprinkle each plate with 1/2 teaspoon powdered sugar; top with 1/4 cup each of blueberries and raspberries. Drizzle each plate with 2 teaspoons maple syrup before serving.

Coconut French Toast with Raspberry Syru.headline: Coconut French Toast with Raspberry Syrup

labels.Yield: 2 servings (serving size: 2 pieces french toast and 4 tablespoons syrup)

instructions.instruction1): In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, and vanilla.

instructions.instruction2): Lightly dip bread slices in egg mixture; pat shredded coconut onto both sides of bread.

instructions.instruction3): Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add bread slices; cook 4 minutes on each side or until golden.

instructions.instruction4): Combine raspberries and maple syrup in a small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave at HIGH 30 seconds. Serve over French toast.

instructions.instruction1): Combine oats and milk in a small bowl; let stand 7 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Stir in apple, almonds, and honey.

labels.Yield: 1 serving (serving size: 4 pieces polenta, 2 eggs, and 6 asparagus spears)

instructions.instruction1): Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add polenta and asparagus; cook 8 minutes, turning once.

instructions.instruction2): Push polenta and asparagus to side of pan. Recoat pan with cooking spray. Add eggs, and fry until yolks are set, about 3 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Serve eggs on warm polenta with asparagus on the side. Sprinkle with cheese and black pepper.

instructions.instruction4): Carb Star: Polenta

instructions.instruction5): 1 gram of Resistant Starch per 1/2 cup cooked

instructions.instruction6): This soft, creamy grain is made from cooked cornmeal. Naturally high in Resistant Starch, polenta is also rich in fiber and contains a decent amount of protein, too. And it's versatile. It can be cooked into a creamy consistency or baked into crunchy sticks. In fact, you can even use it instead of white bread to make croutons.

instructions.instruction1): Sift together first 5 ingredients in a large bowl. Whisk together buttermilk, egg yolks, lemon zest, and vanilla in a separate bowl; add to flour mixture, and stir just until moistened. Beat egg whites with an electric mixer on high speed until soft peaks form; fold gently into batter.

instructions.instruction2): Heat an electric griddle to 350°F; brush with melted butter. Drop batter by 1/4-cupfuls onto hot griddle; top each with 3 to 4 blackberries. Cook until edges are set and bubbles begin to appear, 2 to 3 minutes. Turn with a wide spatula, and cook until golden brown, 1 minute.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°F. Beat butter with a heavy-duty stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment on medium speed until creamy; gradually add granulated sugar, and beat until well combined. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating just until blended after each addition. Beat in 2 teaspoons of the orange zest until blended.

instructions.instruction2): Stir together flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda in a small bowl. Add flour mixture to butter mixture gradually, beating on low speed until blended. Stir in white chocolate chips and cranberries.

instructions.instruction3): Drop cookie dough by heaping tablespoonfuls 1 1/2 inches apart onto parchment paper-lined baking sheets. Bake in preheated oven until lightly browned on bottom, 15 to 17 minutes. Cool cookies on baking sheets 2 minutes; remove cookies to wire racks to cool completely, about 15 minutes.

instructions.instruction4): Whisk together powdered sugar, orange juice, and remaining 1 teaspoon orange zest in a small bowl. Drizzle or pipe glaze over cooled cookies; let stand 20 minutes for glaze to set.

instructions.instruction1): Place cornflakes in a small bowl. Top with milk and berries.

labels.Yield: Makes 1 serving (serving size: 1 waffle with toppings)

instructions.instruction1): Spread waffle with almond butter. Top with strawberries and banana; drizzle with agave nectar.
Combine oats and 1 cup water in a small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high 3 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Top with banana slices, walnuts, and cinnamon.

instructions.instruction1): Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add egg; cook until set, about 3 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Top toast with cheese; place egg over cheese. Serve with apple slices on the side.

instructions.instruction3): Carb Star: Rye, pumpernickel, or sourdough bread

instructions.instruction4): 6 to 3 grams of Resistant Starch per slice

instructions.instruction5): Bread made from rye, pumpernickel, or sourdough is rich in Resistant Starch and fiber. One Swedish study found that rye bread decreased hunger more than whole-wheat bread.

labels.Yield: Makes 6 servings (serving size: 2 waffles, plus syrup)

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 400°. Combine first 7 ingredients (through cloves) in a large bowl. Whisk together next 6 ingredients (through oil) in a medium bowl. Make a well in center of dry ingredients; add wet mixture. Stir just until moist.

instructions.instruction2): Preheat waffle iron, and coat it with cooking spray. Add about 1/2 cup batter, and spread it to edges; cook until the steaming stops. Repeat with remaining batter, setting waffles aside until all are cooked. Place on baking sheets in oven for 5 minutes to crisp.

instructions.instruction3): Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Add walnuts; sauté 3 minutes or until lightly toasted. Add the maple syrup; simmer 2 minutes. Dust waffles with powdered sugar, if desired. Serve with warm syrup.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 375°F. Place first 8 ingredients (through baking powder) in bowl of food processor. Pulse to combine. Add fruit and butter. Pulse again 15-20 times to form a sandy texture. Stir in buttermilk; pulse just enough to combine.

instructions.instruction2): Drop 8 spoonfuls (about 1/2 cup each) onto parchment-lined baking sheet. Dab cold water over surface of each scone to smooth. Sprinkle with about 1/2 tsp sugar, if desired. Bake until scones are golden and sugar has melted (about 30 minutes). Optional: Serve with fat-free Greek yogurt and sugar-free jam.

instructions.instruction1): Lightly spoon flour into a dry measuring cup; level with a knife. Combine flour and the next 4 ingredients (flour through cloves) in a large bowl, and make a well in center of mixture. Combine milk and next 4 ingredients (milk through egg) in a bowl, and add to flour mixture. Stir just until moist.

instructions.instruction2): Coat a waffle iron with cooking spray; preheat. Spoon about 1/4 cup of batter per waffle onto hot waffle iron, spreading the batter to the edges. Cook 5 to 7 minutes or until steaming stops; repeat procedure with remaining batter.

Maple Quinoa Bake with Skillet Apples an.headline: Maple Quinoa Bake with Skillet Apples and Walnuts

labels.Yield: Serves 6 (serving size: 1 cup quinoa bake, 2/3 cup apples, 2 Tbsp. walnuts)

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°F. Stir together milk, quinoa, raisins, eggs, 1/4 cup of the maple syrup, 2 tablespoons of butter, and 1 1/2 teaspoons of the apple pie spice in a medium bowl until blended. Lightly spray an 11- x 7-inch baking dish with cooking spray, and pour quinoa mixture into prepared baking dish. Bake in preheated oven until set, 35 to 40 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Meanwhile, heat remaining 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high. Add apples, and cook, stirring often to coat, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in lemon juice, and remaining 1/4 cup maple syrup and 1/2 teaspoon apple pie spice. Cook, stirring often, until apples are tender-crisp, 5 to 6 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Divide quinoa bake among 6 bowls. Top each evenly with apples and chopped walnuts. Drizzle with maple syrup if desired.

instructions.instruction1): Pour cornflakes into a small bowl, and top with milk and berries.

instructions.instruction2): On-the-Go Alternative: Kashi TLC Chewy Granola Bar and 6 ounces fat-free yogurt.

instructions.instruction1): Combine first 4 ingredients (through blueberries).

instructions.instruction2): Pour about 1/4 cup batter (or use a 2-ounce ice-cream scoop) per pancake onto a hot nonstick griddle or skillet. Cook over medium heat for about 2–3 minutes or until tops are covered with bubbles and edges look cooked. Flip pancakes over, and cook an additional 2–3 minutes or until bottoms are golden brown. Pile on a plate in 1 stack. Cover with a hand towel to keep warm.

instructions.instruction3): Place 2 pancakes on each of 3 plates. Drizzle with the maple syrup, and dust with some powdered sugar, if desired.

instructions.instruction1): Combine first 4 ingredients in a medium bowl; make a well in center of mixture. Combine buttermilk and next 3 ingredients. Add buttermilk mixture to dry ingredients, stirring just until dry ingredients are moistened.

instructions.instruction2): Heat a nonstick griddle or nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heat. For each pancake, pour 1/4 cup batter onto hot griddle, spreading to a 5-inch circle. Cook pancakes until tops are covered with bubbles and edges look cooked; turn pancakes, and cook other side.

instructions.instruction3): Serve with maple syrup and fresh fruit, if desired (syrup and fruit not included in analysis).

instructions.instruction4): Tip: One tablespoon of sugar-free maple syrup has 8 calories and 3 grams of carbohydrate.

Granola with Pecans, Pumpkin Seeds and D.headline: Granola with Pecans, Pumpkin Seeds and Dried Mango

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°.

instructions.instruction2): Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper and reserve.

instructions.instruction3): Combine oats, puffed millet, pecans and pumpkinseeds in a large bowl.

instructions.instruction4): Whisk together canola oil, maple syrup, apple juice, vanilla, and salt in a small bowl and toss with dry ingredients.

instructions.instruction5): Spread on a large parchment-lined baking sheet and bake until golden brown, stirring occasionally, 20-25 minutes.

instructions.instruction6): Remove from oven, let cool completely, and toss with dried mango.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 425°. Lightly coat a doughnut pan with cooking spray.

instructions.instruction2): Combine flours and next 4 ingredients (through salt) in a large bowl, stirring well with a whisk.

instructions.instruction3): Combine buttermilk, eggs, honey, butter, and vanilla, stirring well with a whisk. Add buttermilk mixture to flour mixture; whisk just until combined.

instructions.instruction4): Spoon batter into doughnut pans, filling twothirds full. Bake in middle of oven until doughnuts spring back when touched and are golden on bottom (about 8 minutes). Let cool in pan slightly (about 4 minutes); turn out. Coat with toppings (see ideas, below), if desired.

instructions.instruction6): Lemon Glazed:

instructions.instruction7): Combine 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice and 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar, stirring well with a whisk. Dip 1 side of the cooled doughnuts into glaze; let cool on a rack, glazed side up.

instructions.instruction8): Calories 191

instructions.instruction11): Melt 6 ounces bittersweet chocolate in a bowl in microwave until smooth. Dip tops of doughnuts into chocolate and place chocolate side up on a rack to cool. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup chopped hazelnuts; let sit about 10 minutes.

instructions.instruction15): Melt 4 ounces (1 cup) bittersweet chocolate in microwave until smooth. Fill a small squeeze bottle or zip-top plastic bag (snip a tiny hole in 1 corner of bag) with melted chocolate; pipe chocolate onto tops of doughnuts. Chill doughnuts until chocolate sets (about 10 minutes).

instructions.instruction19): Combine 1/4 cup ground cinnamon and 1/4 cup sugar. While still warm, coat doughnuts in sugar; let cool on rack, sugar-coated side up.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 400ºF. Bring 2 cups water to a boil. Stir in cereal, cinnamon and salt. Simmer, stirring, until tender, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat.

instructions.instruction2): Slice 2 bananas; arrange in a 9-inch pie plate. Toss nuts with 1 Tbsp. syrup. Stir milk, vanilla and remaining syrup into cereal; spread over bananas. Top with nuts.

instructions.instruction3): Bake until browned, 20 to 25 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Slice remaining banana; place on top. Serve.

instructions.instruction1): Combine the Greek-style yogurt, honey, and vanilla extract in a bowl.

instructions.instruction2): Layer the remaining ingredients in each of 6 glasses in this order: papaya pieces, yogurt mixture, pineapple pieces, yogurt mixture, strawberry pieces, yogurt mixture; top each glass evenly with low-fat granola.

Spiced Pumpkin Seed and Millet Cereal.headline: Spiced Pumpkin Seed and Millet Cereal

instructions.instruction1): Place a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add pumpkin seeds and millet; cook, stirring constantly, until seeds and millet are evenly toasted and golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Stir in milk, pumpkin pie spice and salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, without stirring, until millet is tender and most milk has absorbed, about 20 minutes. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Drizzle with honey or agave before serving, if desired.

instructions.instruction1): Bring water, whole milk, and salt to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high. Gradually whisk in uncooked grits; return to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until creamy and thickened, 25 to 30 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in buttermilk and butter.

instructions.instruction2): Stir green chiles and cheese into warm grits. Top each serving with a fried egg, pico de gallo, and fresh cilantro leaves.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°F.

instructions.instruction2): Combine apple cider and apples in a saucepan over medium-high; cover, and cook 10 minutes. Uncover, and cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat; cool 10 minutes. Pour apple mixture into a blender; process until smooth.

instructions.instruction3): Weigh or lightly spoon flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt in a medium bowl; stir with a whisk.

instructions.instruction4): Combine apple mixture, sugar, yogurt, oil, and egg in a medium bowl; stir with a whisk. Add yogurt mixture to flour mixture, and stir until combined.

instructions.instruction5): Coat 2 (6-cavity) doughnut pans with cooking spray. Spoon batter evenly into 12 cavities. Bake at 350°F for 12 minutes or until doughnuts spring back when lightly pressed. Cool in pan for 2 minutes. Invert doughnuts onto a wire rack. Cool completely.

instructions.instruction6): Combine tahini and maple syrup, stirring with a whisk. Add 2 teaspoons water; whisk until smooth. Spread glaze over tops of doughnuts. Let stand until glaze is set.

Sweet Potato Bundt Cake with Creamy Oran.headline: Sweet Potato Bundt Cake with Creamy Orange Glaze

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 375°.

instructions.instruction2): To prepare the cake, coat a 10-inch Bundt pan with cooking spray, and dust with 1 teaspoon flour. Set prepared pan aside.

instructions.instruction3): Combine 1/2 cup milk, oil, vanilla, eggs, and sweet potatoes in a medium bowl.

instructions.instruction4): Lightly spoon 3 cups flour into dry measuring cups; level with a knife. Combine 3 cups flour and next 7 ingredients (3 cups flour through cinnamon) in a large bowl, stirring well with a whisk.

instructions.instruction5): Add milk mixture to flour mixture; beat with a mixer at low speed 2 minutes or until blended. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake at 375° for 55 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted 1 inch from the edge comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes on a wire rack; remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack.

instructions.instruction6): To prepare the glaze, combine powdered sugar and remaining ingredients in a bowl; stir well with a whisk. Drizzle glaze over cake.

labels.Yield: Makes: 8 servings (serving size: 3 pancakes and 3 tbsp topping)

instructions.instruction1): In a bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, and salt. Whisk in buttermilk, eggs, and butter. Stir in peanut butter and bananas.

instructions.instruction2): In a saucepan, warm preserves and syrup.

instructions.instruction3): Heat greased griddle on medium-low. For each pancake, pour 3 TBSP batter; cook until golden brown (3 minutes a side).

instructions.instruction1): In a blender, combine yogurt, honey, vanilla, bananas, peanut butter, and ice; process until smooth.

labels.Yield: Makes 4 servings (serving size: 1 tartine and 6 ounces plain low-fat yogurt)

instructions.instruction1): Stir blackberries, thyme, sugar, lemon juice, and kosher salt together in a medium bowl. Split sourdough baguette lengthwise and cut into 4 pieces; spread each with 1/2 tablespoon butter and top with 1/4 of the blackberry salad. Serve with yogurt.

labels.Yield: Serves 12 (serving size: 1 cup, 2 Tbsp. cream, 1 Tbsp. maple syrup)

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 375°F. Stir together oats, baking powder, cinnamon, ginger, salt, and 1/2 cup of the almonds in a large bowl. Stir together milk, syrup, vanilla, egg, and 3 tablespoons of the butter in a separate bowl. Add oat mixture to milk mixture; stir to combine. Fold in 1/2 of the berries.

instructions.instruction2): Spoon mixture into an 11- x 7-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Top with remaining almonds and berries. Bake in preheated oven until set and golden, 35 to 40 minutes.

instructions.instruction3): Remove from oven. Drizzle with remaining 3 tablespoons melted butter. Serve in shallow bowls; drizzle each serving with heavy cream and maple syrup.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 350°. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, and set aside.

instructions.instruction2): Combine flour, oats, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a food processor. Process 10 seconds or until oats are finely chopped. Add butter; process until mixture resembles coarse meal.

instructions.instruction3): Transfer flour mixture to a large mixing bowl; stir in cherries and crystallized ginger.

instructions.instruction4): Combine buttermilk and egg whites in a small bowl; stir with a whisk. Add buttermilk mixture to flour mixture; stir just until a sticky dough forms.

instructions.instruction5): Transfer dough to parchment paperlined baking sheet, and pat into a 9-inch circle (about 1-inch thick). Sprinkle with all-purpose flour, if necessary, to keep the dough from sticking to hands. Divide the dough into 8 equal wedges. Separate wedges slightly, and bake at 350° for 25 minutes or until golden brown and a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.

labels.Yield: Makes 4 servings (serving size: 1 slice bread, 1/2 cup spinach, 1 tablespoon hollandaise, 1 egg)

instructions.instruction1): Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; sauté spinach for 3 minutes until wilted. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Arrange toasted sourdough bread on 4 plates; divide spinach among toast slices and set aside. Bring a high-sided skillet filled with 2 inches of water to a simmer; add vinegar. Working one at a time, break each eggs into a ramekin and slide into simmering water. Gently poach 3 minutes; remove with a slotted spoon. Place 1 egg on top of each spinach toast (reserve last egg). In a blender, combine yolk from remaining poached egg (discard white) with mayonnaise, lemon juice, and water; blend until smooth. Add melted butter; blend to combine. Spoon hollandaise over eggs and serve immediately.

Heat broiler with rack 4 inches from heat. Place brown sugar on a plate; dip cut sides of banana in sugar. Place banana cut side up on a baking sheet; broil 3-5 minutes, rotating sheet often, until banana is browned. Spread rye toast with peanut butter; top with banana.

Sun-Dried Tomato, Goat Cheese, and Fresh.headline: Sun-Dried Tomato, Goat Cheese, and Fresh Basil Frittata

instructions.instruction1): Step 1: Sauté vegetables. Preheat the oven to broil. Use a well-seasoned, 10-inch iron skillet or a nonstick skillet with a heatproof handle. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in the skillet over medium-high heat, and add 1 cup minced onion. Cook until the onion is translucent, about 3 minutes.

instructions.instruction2): Step 2: Add the egg mixture to pan. Whisk together 4 large eggs and 2 egg whites, and season with 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the onions, patting down any lumps with a wooden spoon. Scatter 3 ounces sun-dried tomatoes, packed without oil evenly over the pan surface.

instructions.instruction3): Step 3: Add cheese and put in broiler. Distribute 1/4 cup (2 ounces) goat cheese over the top of the frittata, then place the skillet under the broiler for 2 minutes, until the frittata rises slightly and becomes light and settled. Remove from broiler and top with 1/4 cup basil chiffonade. (Stack basil, then roll the stack, and slice it into feathery, 1/4-inch pieces.)

instructions.instruction4): Step 4: Plate and serve. To remove the frittata from the iron skillet, place a large plate over the top of the pan, invert the frittata onto the plate, and cut it into wedges. With a nonstick skillet, slide the frittata onto a serving plate, then cut into wedges.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 400°. Coat inside of a deep-dish 9-inch pie plate with 1 teaspoon olive oil; set aside.

instructions.instruction2): Combine potatoes and egg white in a large bowl. Toss lightly. Add flour and salt; toss to coat. Transfer to pie plate, and pat evenly into bottom and sides to form crust. Drizzle remaining 2 teaspoons oil over crust. Bake at 400° for 15 minutes, or until edges begin to brown. Remove from oven. Reduce oven temperature to 350°.

instructions.instruction3): While crust bakes, place spinach, onion, and 2 tablespoons water in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on HIGH 2 minutes or until spinach begins to wilt. Drain. Place spinach mixture in a colander and squeeze to drain; coarsely chop and set aside.

instructions.instruction4): Combine eggs and ricotta cheese in a large mixing bowl; stir with a whisk until smooth. Season to taste with black pepper. Stir in spinach mixture, half of Swiss cheese, and bacon.

instructions.instruction5): Pour egg mixture over potato crust, spreading with the back of a spoon to distribute evenly. Leave a 1/2-inch crust along the outer edge. Sprinkle remaining Swiss cheese on top. Bake at 350° for 50 to 55 minutes, until puffed and golden. Let cool on a wire rack 10 to 15 minutes before serving.

instructions.instruction1): Warm a skillet over medium heat. Cook the bacon until crisp. Set aside.

instructions.instruction2): Place muffin, cut-side down, in skillet. Press to toast (2 minutes). Set aside.

instructions.instruction3): Coat skillet with cooking spray. Cook egg about 30 seconds. Sprinkle with pepper and cheese. Cook until set. Transfer egg to muffin half. Top with the bacon, jalapeño, onion, tomato, cilantro, and second muffin half.

labels.Yield: 8 servings (serving size: 1 piece of French toast and about 1/3 cup warm blueberry sauce)

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to lowest setting (about 200°).

instructions.instruction2): Place a large, shallow baking dish in oven to warm.

instructions.instruction3): Combine the eggs, milk, maple syrup, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl, stirring with a whisk until the mixture is well blended. Place 2 slices whole wheat bread in batter, and soak for 2 minutes.

instructions.instruction4): Heat a large nonstick or cast-iron skillet over medium heat. Melt butter or heat oil in skillet, swirling pan to spread it around. Lift bread slices out of batter, letting them drain slightly, and place bread in skillet. Cook until golden, flipping once (about 2-3 minutes on each side). Transfer toast to the warm baking dish in the oven. Repeat the procedure with remaining bread slices. Serve hot with warm blueberry sauce spooned on top. Garnish with additional blueberries, if desired.

instructions.instruction1): Heat a griddle or skillet over medium-low heat.

instructions.instruction2): Whisk together first 6 ingredients (through almond extract) in a medium bowl. Gradually whisk in both types of milk. Pour mixture into a shallow baking dish. Working in batches, if necessary, place bread in dish and let soak 3 minutes on each side.

instructions.instruction3): Coat a griddle or skillet with cooking spray. For each slice of the bread, place 2 tablespoons almonds in a single (but fairly densely packed) layer on the hot griddle, forming an area the size and shape of a bread slice. Press 1 side of the bread into the almonds, and cook 4 minutes or until golden brown. (You will probably need to repeat this process in 2 batches.) Flip the bread over, and cook 3–4 minutes or until speckled golden brown. Serve immediately.

instructions.instruction1): Warm oil in a large broilerproof skillet over medium heat. Add leeks, salt and pepper; toss to coat. Cover and cook, stirring often, until softened, about 10 minutes. Uncover and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender and glossy, 10 minutes longer. Transfer to a plate; let cool slightly. Rinse and dry skillet.

instructions.instruction2): Preheat broiler. In a bowl, combine mayonnaise, mustard and chipotle. Stir in Cheddar, pimentos and leeks.

instructions.instruction3): Spread 1 tsp. butter on 1 side of each bread slice. Sprinkle with Parmigiano-Reggiano; press to adhere. Flip bread; spread with pimento cheese. Place sandwiches in skillet, pimento cheese--side up. Cook over medium heat until bottom is golden, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer skillet to oven. Broil until bubbling and browning in spots, about 2 minutes. Serve.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 375°. Bake pastry shell for 10–12 minutes or until browned. Remove shell from oven, and set aside. Leave oven on.

instructions.instruction2): Heat 1 1/4 teaspoons oil over medium heat in a large nonstick skillet; add shallots. Add spinach, and cook 2–3 minutes or until wilted. Add 1/4 teaspoon salt and a dash of pepper. Transfer to a plate; set aside

instructions.instruction3): Using the same pan, heat remaining oil, and cook mushrooms about 6 minutes or until browned on both sides. Remove from heat. Season with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.

instructions.instruction4): Sprinkle 1/3 cup Parmesan cheese over bottom of pastry crust. Top with spinach and mushrooms.

instructions.instruction5): In a separate bowl, whisk together soy milk with egg and egg whites. Pour into shell. Top with remaining 1/3 cup Parmesan, and bake for 45–50 minutes or until top is firm and golden brown. Cut into wedges and serve.

instructions.instruction1): Preheat oven to 375º.

instructions.instruction2): Combine bananas and next 4 ingredients (through vanilla) in a medium bowl; mix well, and set aside.

instructions.instruction3): Lightly spoon flour into a dry measuring cup and level with a knife. Whisk together flour and next 5 ingredients (through salt) in a small bowl.

instructions.instruction4): Stir the flour mixture into the banana mixture until they are just combined.

instructions.instruction5): Spray 9 muffin cups with cooking spray (or use paper liners), and spoon 1/3 cup batter into each cup (cups will be full).

instructions.instruction6): Bake 16 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.

instructions.instruction1): Heat oil in a 10-inch, oven-safe skillet or sauté pan. Add onion and pepper; sauté over medium heat 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add mushrooms, cover, and sauté 3 minutes, stirring several times. Add garlic, and sauté 1 additional minute. Remove vegetable mixture from heat, and transfer to a plate to cool briefly. Wipe pan with paper towels, and return to stove.

instructions.instruction2): Combine eggs, egg whites, milk, salt, pepper, and basil in a large bowl, stirring with a whisk until well blended; set aside. Heat skillet over medium heat for 2-3 minutes and add butter, swirling pan to melt butter evenly. Add vegetables to egg mixture in bowl, stir, and carefully pour entire mixture into heated skillet. Scatter cherry tomatoes and cheese over egg mixture (do not stir).

instructions.instruction3): Cook frittata gently over medium-low heat 15-18 minutes or untilit is cooked most of the way through. To finish cooking the top, preheat broiler and place the frittata about 6-8 inches from heat for 2-4 minutes (watch frittata carefully to ensure that it doesn't burn).

instructions.instruction4): Remove frittata from oven, cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes, and shake pan rapidly back and forth to loosen. Cool a few more minutes, then carefully put a plate over the frittata and invert it onto the plate. Invert it again onto another plate so the frittata is right side up. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
